channel.title: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!
channel.description:
Hey,
In the past few weeks, I made this [url=http://awepsyte.50webs.com/Bomberman/Bomberman/Bomberman.html]Bomberman[/url]. Please rate it, and post a reason why. If the applet is too big for your screen, try using fullscreen (press F11).[url=http://awepsyte.50webs.com/Bomberman/Bomberman/Applet1.java]This[/url] is the source code, you can have a look at it, but don't use it like it's yours please. It has one or two bugs I am aware of, but I haven't been able to fix them yet. One is that the game suddenly freezes/lags a lot (try pausing and continueing the game (a few times)), which is NOT an exception error. Another is that, after a bomb exploded, it still 'thinks' there is a bomb, but you can't see it, nor walk there, not very common.
Oh, and if anyone knows how to adjust the volume of sounds, please tell me, because now the music is too loud, I think.
Greets
~Supamagier
PS: In case you like it/or think it's (very) nice, I could use some rep. :D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 05, 2008, 09:26:18 PM[/size][hr]Please post a reason when rating.

item.title: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Ok, I will, and I assure you, I didn’t leech this. (except for the sprites/sounds ofc)

Read full topic

[quote][quote]You use the word ‘void’.

You want me to use the word method?[/quote]Uh, yeah, proper naming is nice.
I assure you, Yz85Racer is not jealous.[/quote]
Yeah agreed. Using the correct words would be a lot better, and a lot less ‘moparscape’ style.

Silver Lining:

Yz85Racer is not jealous.

Indeed.

item.title: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

You use the word 'void'.
You want me to use the word method?
Your code looks nothing like each other.
That is a stupid reason, everyone has his own programming style.
You say you've worked on all of your games for a few weeks each, yet you release about a week apart.
Wrong. Read the 'pong' post better, I said it's an OLD game I made.
You didn't know what AI was.
That doesn't say a thing, before I made this game, I didn't even know what OOP is, and beside, I'm Dutch, so by AI, how the heck should I know what it is? I hardly know the words.
You go really defensive at first site of criticism.
Nah, I don't, I just say reasons why, and next to that, I also use that criticism, as I used OOP now, for the first time.

I just think you’re jealeous or something, so leave my topic alone, or stop saying I leeched it.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:19, topic:196352”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=260914.msg2167982#msg2167982 date=1207566386]
I think I’ve just discovered this is leached.
[/quote]
Fuck you, it isn’t. And if you think it is, post your fucking reasons, ass.

Oh, ok, I thought about that, but couldn’t figure out how to make it work.

Basically it consists of "if"s.

True, just cba to make it :P[/quote]
My reasons:
Your code looks nothing like each other.
You go really defensive at first site of criticism.
You say you’ve worked on all of your games for a few weeks each, yet you release about a week apart.
You use the word ‘void’.
You didn’t know what AI was.

supamagier:

You’re right about the seperate files, but I had a reason not to… although I can’t remember it now :s

I could be here all night.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Thanks for your comment Yakman, about the runnable thing, I don’t really get what you mean - could you explain that more please?

With the double imports and stuff, you’re right, I should have realised that

About the ‘showtime’, if you look at the timeField_textValueChanged(event) method, you’ll see I took care of the parse thing, so that you only can enter numbers. - Same with all other fields, so I suppose my program is robust enough (at that).

You’re right about the seperate files, but I had a reason not to… although I can’t remember it now :s

~Supamagier

Read full topic
item.source: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!

item.title: Java Bomberman - Please rate this please!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

you also might want to learn about java threading and concurrency, that bug about still thinking there is a bug is probably caused by a race condition

bugs that only happen sometimes, when the wind is blowing the right way, or the phase of the moon is right, are typical of thread-related bugs

like you use the field “running” to control the other thread, what happens if its false? the thread loops uselessly and probably lags the game
use Object.wait() and Object.notify() for this

also

	//{{DECLARE_CONTROLS
	java.awt.Button pauzeKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button stopKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button controlsKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button instructionsKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button rulesKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button mainMenuKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button playKnop = new java.awt.Button();
	java.awt.Button instructionsKnop2 = new java.awt.Button();

and you do “import java.awt.*;” at the top?
if you have ambiguous classes, just do like “import java.awt.Button;”

and this?

showTime = Integer.parseInt(timeField.getText())+":00";

what if your user inputs something which isnt parsable as an integer? it would crash that whole thread you started
your program needs to be robust, meaning it can handle any input gracefully, you need to expect everything,

try this

int inputtedTime = 0;
try {
    inputtedTime = Integer.parseInt(timeField.getText());
}
catch(NumberFormatException ex) {
    //do something here, probably tell the user he's screwed up
}
showTime = inputtedTime + ":00";

how about putting your class Player, Bomb, Item and Explosion each in their own separate files

Read full topic
